meanings.definition: To scream louder than someone or something else.
meanings.sent1: During the concert, the lead singer outscreams the cheering fans.
meanings.sent2: The little girl outscreams her brother when they play outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat outscreams the dog when they have a meowing contest.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm outscreams the howling wind in the dark night.
meanings.sent5: Her excitement outscreams her fear as she rides the roller coaster.

meanings.definition: To make a loud, high-pitched cry or sound.
meanings.sent1: The fire alarm outscreams all other noises in the building.
meanings.sent2: The teapot outscreams as it reaches boiling point.
meanings.sent3: The excited puppy outscreams with joy when its owner returns home.
meanings.sent4: The whistle of the train outscreams the chatter of the passengers.
meanings.sent5: The soprano singer outscreams the orchestra with her powerful voice.
